availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: McHenry Osborne (Monroe County, KY, laborer and convict)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, laborer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Osborne. Father of John Osborne, Mary Osborne, Sarah Osborne, Elizabeth Osborne, Babe Osborne, Lucinda Osborne, and Carolina Osborne. Laborer in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1850. Convicted of malicious stabbing by the Ohio Circuit Court in March 1860. Inmate in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort from April 20, 1860 to January 1861. Pardoned on January 5, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 406A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 286.
KYR-0001-025-0044.
